outputs.output_descr:
1.1:  A functional and sustainable Dzongkhag (District) Environmental Committee (DEC) Focal Point Secretariat established within the NECS  with the capacity to manage and coordinate the DEC environmental management tasks and responsibilities.
1.2:  An approved and funded Training Curriculum and related Action Plan for DECs on how to implement comply to and monitor Bhutanese commitments to EAs and other provisions of the Rio Conventions.
1.3:  Training-of-trainers learning materials for environmental management awareness and training workshops for DEC members developed.
1.4:  Enhanced capacity of key staff from NECS and concerned line ministries  to conduct/lead Training-of Trainers initiatives as part of their regular activities related to decentralized development planning, implementation and monitoring.
2.1:  Supportive institutional structure of DECs established in all Districts.
2.2:  Technical environmental management manpower capacity in DECs established in all Districts.
2.3:  Increased capacity and knowledge base amongst the DEC members to carry out decentralized environmental management and compliance in line with global environmental requirements.
2.4:  Increased capacity of the DECs to fund decentralized environmental management activities addressing Bhutan's commitments to implement the 3 Rio Conventions.
3.1:  Set of uniform indicators and guidance for application are established for measuring the contribution of decentralized environmental management towards meeting global environmental objectives.
3.2:  The Rio Convention Focal Points are enabled to take into account the decentralized environmental management activities in their reporting on Bhutan's commitments to implement the 3 Rio Conventions.
